flow.descriptionCdata:
71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.0668fecb-1a67-4432-b6a9-617153ddae6f.description=
This operation can be used to find the SA version in the form of 'sasXXX' (Similar to the entries in the Selection List 'SAS Version'). Output of this operations  could be mapped to the input parameter 'coreVersion' which is used in other SA Operations. For SA version 6.x, this operation is not supported. For other SA versions, if the output variable 'coreVersion' is reported with 'UNKNOWN', then user is recommended to manually find the SA version to use in other SA Operations.

Inputs\:
coreHost - IP Address or DNS name of the SA Web Service.
corePort - HTTP(S) port of SA Web Service. By default it is '443'.
coreProtocol - HTTP / HTTPS. By default it is 'HTTPS'.
coreUsername - Username of the SA.
corePassword - Password of SA user.

Outputs\:
status - Operation completion Status.
coreVersion - SA version.  It could be one of [sas7, sas75, sas78, sas9, sas91, UNKNOWN].

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data
71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.1924f32f-fd76-45e2-a5e7-91bb48e560dc.description=Retrieves the properties of a software policy object. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The policy name search string (can be a partial name and multiple return results can be returned). policyID - The id of the software policy. Use this input for unique identification. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: createdBy - The name of the user who created this object. createdDate - The date that this object was created. id - The unique ID of this object. createdBy - The name of the user who created this object. createdDate - The date that this object was created. dirtyAttributes - A ; delimited list of attributes that are dirty (Modified and not yet fully propagated). modifiedBy - The user who last modified this object. modifiedDate - The date that this object was last modified on. description - The description of this object. hostname - The DNS hostname of this object. model - The model of this object. osVersion - The version of the OS running on the object. primaryIP - The primary IP address of this object. serialNumber - This object's serial number. manufacturer - The manufacturer of this object. associatedServerNames - A ; delimited list of server names associated with this software policy. platformName - The name of the platform. softwarePolicyName - The name of this object's Software policy. buildSignature - The ism control build signature of the software policy. manifest - The ism control build manifest of the software policy. 71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.3fc652b3-ab58-4097-9fec-0596e1f68e77.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.797b4d97-9e2d-4da0-ae10-1cf18bca7e44.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.905d485e-b507-4bd4-992b-822e286f4992.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The names of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). serverId - The IDs of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). If provided, the 'serverName' is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. sortPolicies - Specify whether the software policies should be remediated in alphabetical order, based on their names, on each server. The default value is 'false'. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The timezone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.9815941b-c118-4892-ae50-269af98a0d04.description=
Waits for the job specified by its jobId to finish (reach a completion state) and following completion, returns information for the specified job.

Inputs\:
    host - The host that is running the ICSP.
    port -  The port on the host running the ICSP.
Default value\: 443
    protocol - The protocol.
Valid values\: http, https
Default value\: https
    proxyHost - The proxy host.
    proxyPort -  The proxy server port.
    proxyUsername - The proxy server user name.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the  input value.
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file.
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used. If no trustKeystore is given the default Operations Orchestration studio or central truststore will be used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file.
    timeout - The time to wait for a connection to be established, in milliseconds. This input needs a value greater than or equal to zero. A  value of '0' represents an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0
    version - The ICSP version. If empty, the operation obtains the version from the specified ICSP host.
Valid values\: 7.4
    sessionId - The session id.
    jobId - The id of the job for which the information will be retrieved.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary result. This is the raw result received from the ICSP server.
    category - Resource category used for authorizations and resource type groupings.
    created - Date and time when the job was created.
    description - Text description of the type of the job.
    etag - Entity tag/version ID of the resource, the same value that is returned in the ETag header on a GET of the resource.
    jobDeviceGroups - An array of device groups associated with this job. This is a JSon formatted string.
    jobProgress - A JSon formatted array of Job progress. A single Job can contain progress for multiple servers. Job progress is only available when the job is running.
    jobResult - A JSon formatted array of Job results. A single Job can contain results for multiple servers. Job result is only available once the Job completes.
    jobServerInfo - A JSon formatted array of servers and their details associated with this Job.
    jobUserName - The name of the user under whose authority this job was invoked.
    modified - Date and time when the job was last modified.
    name - Display name for the job.
    nameOfJobType - The name of the type of the job. In some cases has the same value as the field "name".
    running - Indicates whether the job is running.  Possible values are\: TRUE or FALSE
    state - A constant to help explain what state a job is in. Possible values are\: STATUS_ABORTED, STATUS_ACTIVE, STATUS_BLOCKED, STATUS_DELETED, STATUS_EXPIRED, STATUS_FAILURE, STATUS_PENDING, STATUS_RECURRING, STATUS_STALE, STATUS_SUCCESS, STATUS_TERMINATED, STATUS_TERMINATING, STATUS_UNKNOWN, STATUS_WARNING, or STATUS_ZOMBIE.
    status - Overall status of the job. Possible values are\: ok, warning, error, or unknown.
    type - Identifies the resource type. This will be set to OSDJob
    typeOfJobType - A constant that indicates what type of job it is\: BP, BPX, ILO, or APX
    uri - The canonical URI of the resource.
    uriOfJobType - The canonical URI of the OS Build Plan.
    jobId - The jobId. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    1. A job is considered to have succeeded if completes with a status of 'ok' or 'warning'.  As a best practice, other results (e.g. jobResult) should be
        examined to determine success at a more granular level.
    2. See the Base content pack 'Library/Operations/HTTP Client/' operations description for additional information about how specific http inputs work.
71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.a0f939ae-3bd5-42b6-bab2-ba9329597ab8.prompt=Enter the SAS version used\: 71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.a3fb6f7d-25eb-4954-b088-c253c54f6541.description=Attaches a software policy to a list of servers/device groups/hypervisors. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The name of the policy to attach. policyID - The ID of the policy to attach. If this input is provided, then 'policyName' is ignored. attachableName - The names, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. attachableID - The IDs, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. If this input is provided, then 'attachableName' is ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable objects (all must be of the same type). Can be\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. 71f480b4-444a-4370-b905-2ad7f021f331.dddb0f64-39ea-48ae-bb8a-b3510e8d08a7.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
flow.name: VPC - SA POLICY
